revised_title: Continuity in Major Populations of Migrant Pests: The Desert Locust and the African Armyworm
tldr: The authors analyze the continuity in major populations of migrant pests, the Desert Locust and the African armyworm. They propose that high-density populations are always present and that both species regularly undertake long-distance migrations. This understanding can help in predicting and controlling pest attacks.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Ecology and Population Dynamics
